title: Lizzo, RuPaul, Monica Lewinsky among those reading 'The New Colossus' in promo for Statue of Liberty documentary
text:
Monica Lewinsky, Lizzo, Jessica Chastain and Whoopi Goldberg Whoopi GoldbergHuntsman of 'The View' declares Castro campaign dead after Biden moment 'The View' panel slams lawmakers who skipped 9/11 moment of silence: 'Shameful' Ted Cruz praises Whoopi Goldberg 'for speaking out for free speech' MORE are among the celebrities reciting the words to the poem inscribed on the Statue of Liberty for a new project about the famed landmark.

The voices of the high-profile figures — along with others such as RuPaul, Cyndi Lauper and Courtney Love — can be heard reading Emma Lazarus’s famous poem "The New Colossus."

ADVERTISEMENT

The video, released Thursday, is part of a promotional campaign from HBO and World of Wonder for the upcoming documentary from fashion designer Diane Von Fursternburg on the Statue of Liberty, called "Liberty: Mother of Exiles."

The doc premieres on Oct. 17 on HBO.

The reading comes after Ken Cuccinelli, the acting head of U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services, made headlines in August when he said during an interview that the poem on the Statue of Liberty welcoming immigrants to the United States was meant to refer to "people coming from Europe."

Also among the celebrities reading the lines of the 1883 poem are Regina Spektor, Charo and Andy Cohen.
description: Monica Lewinsky, Lizzo, Jessica Chastain and Whoopi Goldberg are among the celebrities reciting the words to the poem inscribed on the Statue of Liberty for a new project about the famed landmark.
